column4: i have a problem with an external DVD burner (usb), how can i mount this on ubuntu 9.04?
it mounts when you put a disc in
least, mine does.
k3b does not see it!
is the icon on your desktop tho
k3b
detects it on mine.
try adding it manually in k3b prefs
try *shudder*  Brasero
or are you in KDE
let me just plug mine in and have a look.. (usb  powered liteon :) )
what do you get with lsusb ?
k3b see it only when i put in an audio CD, when i put a blank-dvd, k3b cancel it from list device
I have to ask (sorry)   does it support the media you are inserting?
like, does it support the + or - or both etc... what make is the writer btw ?
odd.... I cant suggest anything other than use something else.. I swear by k3b tho... brasero has done nothing for me with the 5 writers ive tried
i know that the system mount the dvd on /dev/sr1
try from shell.
growisofs  to burn iso or mkisofs to burn files
since you know the /dev location
seems growisofs does files too :)  oops    man growisofs
or, (not tried it myself)  try gnomebaker
